revised_title: On the Scattering and Absorption of Homogeneous β-Rays and the Number of Electrons in the Atom
tldr: The authors investigate the scattering and absorption of homogeneous β-rays and use the results to determine the number of electrons in an atom. They find that the mean deflection experienced by a β-particle passing through a material is dependent on the number of atoms per unit volume, the radius of an atom, and the mean deflection angle produced by an atom.
